VLIB_originalfast12_detectCorners

Detailed Description


Functions

void VLIB_originalfast12_detectCorners (const uint8_t *restrict im, int32_t xsize, int32_t ysize, int32_t stride, int32_t marginPixels, int32_t b, int32_t *ret_n_features, CORBFeature *ret_features)

Function Documentation

void VLIB_originalfast12_detectCorners ( const uint8_t *restrict  im,
int32_t  xsize,
int32_t  ysize,
int32_t  stride,
int32_t  marginPixels,
int32_t  b,
int32_t *  ret_n_features,
CORBFeature *  ret_features 
)

Description:
Detects and returns corners in image im based on FAST12 algorithm.
Parameters:
[in] *im Pointer to the image buffer - Must be double-word(64-bit) aligned.
[in] xsize Image width - Must be a multiple of 8.
[in] ysize Image height - Must be a multiple of 8.
[in] stride Image stride
[in] marginPixels Fast corners will not be found within this distance from each edge of the image
[in] b The FAST difference threshold. A pixel must be this much brighter/darker than the center to be considered different
[out] ret_n_features The number of features detected
[out] *ret_features A pointer to allocated memory, to store the detected features - Must be double-word(64-bit) aligned.
Assumptions:
  • im and ret_features must both be double-word(64-bit) aligned.
  • xsize and ysize must both be a multiple of 8
  • xsize must be greater than CEILING(marginPixels, 4) * 2.
  • ysize must be greater than 2 * marginPixels.
  • Max number of features to find is set to CORB_MAX_FEATURES, therefore, the ret_features buffer should be allocated CORB_MAX_FEATURES*sizeof(CORBFeature)
Implementation Notes:
  • This code is compatible with C6XXX fixed point processors.
Benchmarks:
See VLIB_Test_Report.html for cycle and memory information.
